section.name: Management interface
section.p:
The management interface of JIAC TNG is based on JMX (Java Management Extensions). Every JVM contains a MBean server where all manageable resources (agent nodes, agents, agent beans and other resources) are registered. All interfaces *MBean (e.g.
SimpleAgentNodeMBean, AgentMBean and AbstractAgentBeanMBean) specify the manageable attributes (getter and setter methods) and the executable operations (all other public methods) of these resources.

subsection.name: Local Management
Remote Management
subsection.p: To manage resources which are located in another JVM (agent node) you have to use a MBean server connection to a JMX connector server of the remote JVM instead of a reference to the local MBean server. Different protocol implementations for a JMX connector already exist (e.g. RMI, SOAP, WS, JMS) but only the RMI connector is part of JRE version 1.5 or higher.
